name: insensitivity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a lack of feeling or sympathy for other people's feelings, or an unwillingness to give importance to something: insensitivity towards His insensitivity towards the feelings of others is remarkable.insensitivity to Her opponents have said the remark shows insensitivity to the situation.
a lack of reaction to something, or a lack of ability to feel something: insensitivity to The anaesthetic is used to cause insensitivity to pain. Diabetes begins as a cellular insensitivity to insulin. See
insensitive
More examplesFewer examplesThe insensitivity shown to the families and victims involved is unbelievable.He is a politician with a track record of insensitivity and arrogance.People born with insensitivity to pain can inflict serious injuries on themselves.At present it is thought that obesity in humans may result in part from insensitivity to leptin.
